Hmm? Haven't you heard? Those hungry $item:61000002$ monsters can actually be tamed as pets.
Why would I want a pet slime?
You really don't know? Tamed pets not only enhance your attributes, but they'll fight by your side.
How does one tame a monster?
Well, you can't tame just any monster. It has to be a hungry one. $npc:11003507[gender:1]$ over there can tell you more.
What are you still looking at me for? If you want to learn about monster taming, talk to $npc:11003507[gender:1]$ over there.
You want to learn how to tame monsters? And why, may I ask, is that?
Adventuring alone gets lonely y'know.
I'm want to get an edge over my enemy in combat.
So you're looking for a friend, eh? I can help you out with that. Let me know when you're ready to get down to business.
That's all well and good, but you should know your pet won't fight your battles for you. Well then, let me know when you're ready to get down to business.
Let's dive right in. You probably know that there's a brand of candy designed specifically for monster taste buds. What you may not know, is that it is key to taming them.
Monster candy? Where can I get some?
Lots of merchants sell it. It just so happens that I've already placed a special order with $npc:11003508[gender:1]$. I'll give you some of my candy if you pick up my order.
Do you see $npc:11003508[gender:1]$ over there? You can pick up my order from that pile next to her. Be careful, it's kind of heavy.
You brought it! Here, you can have these. Now that you have your candy, $npc:11003503[gender:0]$ can show you how monster taming works in practice.
You want to learn how to tame monsters? Well, you're in the right place! There are plenty of hungry $itemPlural:61000002$ right over there. You brought some $itemPlural:63000000$, right?
All right. The process is quite simple, actually. Just throw the candy at one of those hungry $itemPlural:61000002$. Keep feeding the monster, and it'll let down its guard and approach you.
How will I know when it's working?

Well that's easy. As you feed it candy, it will grow docile, and then a heart will appear above its head. And then, you strike! But that's a separate lesson. For now, just try feeding one of those $itemPlural:61000002$ until it lets you close.

As you feed the monster, a bar will appear over its head indicating how comfortable it is with you. If the bar is yellow or red, it means you'll need to use more candy to pacify it, but it also means there's a chance the beast is a rare one.
Is something the matter?
Where do I find those $itemPlural:61000002$ again?
I used up my candy.
All this candy-throwing is too much work.
You're having trouble finding hungry $itemPlural:61000002$? If you hunt the slimes nearby, it shouldn't be long before a hungry $item:61000002$ shows up.
Got it.
Isn't there anywhere else I can find them?
Somewhere besides $map:02000017$? Of course. If you look up the $item:61000002$ in the Pet Album, you can see the various habitats where it resides.
You... didn't eat it all, did you? You buy more from $npc:11003506[gender:1]$ over there. Supply Merchants in major towns also sell the candy.
If you haven't already, you should add the candy to a quickslot so you can use it more easily. Be sure to face the monster that you want to tame before you throw it. Easy, right?
I'll give it another try.
What's the deal with that bar over the monster's head?
Yeah! Good luck! Let me know if you have any other questions.

As you feed the monster, a bar will appear over its head indicating how comfortable it is with you. If the bar is yellow or red, it means you'll need to use more candy to calm it down, but it also means there's a chance the beast is a rare one.

Looks like you're a natural! Now that you know how to pacify $itemPlural:61000002$, why don't you try capturing one? First, there's a tool you'll need to craft. $npc:11003507[gender:1]$ will show you how. You can use these materials.
Ah, you want to craft a monster trap, do you? it looks like $npc:11003503[gender:0]$ gave you everything you need to put together a $item:63100000$.
All you need to do to craft the $item:63100000$ is open the Life Skills window and navigate to Leisure > Pet Taming.
The higher your Pet Taming mastery, the higher the grade of snares you can craft. Now, go see $npc:11003503[gender:0]$ to learn how to capture pets.
Now, go capture yourself one of those $itemPlural:61000002$! You remember how to tame them, right?
Yeah, I heard.
I may have forgotten.
Okay. So once you've pacified the $item:61000002$ with delicious monster candy, it will follow you. The trick is to set your trap on the ground and lead the monster into it.
That's how it works! But remember that if the monster isn't docile when it steps into the trap, it's not going to work. Now, go try capturing a $item:61000002$.
It's simple. You just throw candy at it until a heart appears over its head. Then, it's time to capture it!
Okay, I remember now.
What would you like me to explain?
How do I pacify a monster?
How do I capture a pacified monster?
How do I find hungry monsters?
It's simple. You just throw candy at it until a heart appears over its head. Then you know what to do next, right?
Yeah, I heard.
Would you mind explaining one more time?
You have to lead the monster over the trap while it's pacified. It won't work otherwise. Now, go try capturing a $item:61000002$.
Good! Why don't you give it another go? Remember, you can't capture a monster until you've pacified it.
You don't know where to find hungry monsters? Hungry monsters show up as blue dots on the minimap. Got it?
Got it!
What if there aren't any hungry monsters around?
All right. Good luck!
You can't find any hungry $itemPlural:61000002$? Maybe they're off foraging for food. Why don't you try beating up their slime friends? I bet they'll come running to help!
Sometimes hungry $itemPlural:61000002$ will appear if you just wait here long enough. Of course, you can find them in other areas as well.
I see.
Where else can I find them?
In addition to $map:63000056$, you can find $itemPlural:61000002$ at the habitats listed on the monster's Pet Album card.
Good job! You'll need to keep practicing and get good at pet taming if you want to pass the test to join Team Mushroom.
Is it your first time here? Have you captured pets before?
Yep!

Ah, then perhaps you're here to learn about leveling up your pets through fusion? If you have multiple pets, you can fuse one pet with another to increase the first pet's experience. Why don't you try leveling your $item:61000002$ through pet fusion?
Do you have any questions I can answer?
How does pet fusion work?
I don't have any pets I can fuse.
To fuse your pets, navigate to the Character menu and open the Pets window. Then go to the Fusion tab.
If you don't have enough pets to fuse, try capturing those hungry $itemPlural:61000002$ there.
Oh, right!
I can't find any hungry $itemPlural:61000002$.
I've forgotten how to tame monsters...
You can't find any hungry monsters? Then hunt the $itemPlural:61000002$ nearby until a hungry $item:61000002$ shows up to help its friends!
Sometimes hungry $itemPlural:61000002$ will appear if you just wait here long enough. Of course, you can find them in other areas as well.
Got it.
Where else can I find them?
In addition to $map:63000056$, you can find $itemPlural:61000002$ at the habitats listed on the monster's Pet Album page.
Throw the $itemPlural:63000000$ to a hungry monster to pacify it. Once the monster is fond of you, a heart will appear over its head, and it will follow you.
Thank you.
How do I capture it?
Set up a trap, and lure the monster with the heart over its head into it! You can craft traps like the $item:63100000$ by opening the Life Skills window and navigating to Leisure > Pet Taming.
Thank you.
Now, go and level up that $item:61000002$.
Good. Keep helping your pet grow. A high level one will be much more useful to you.

Hm? The chest was empty? That's strange, I know I filled it... uh, last week? Nevermind, just take these. If you want something to test them on, we just got a huge shipment of $npcPlural:29000403$. Nobody'll miss one or two.
I don't feel much like chatting right now. Maybe I'll feel better after throwing some bombs around in $map:02000499$.
Aw, cheer up.
You're going to... throw bombs?
I lost those items you gave me...
Life as a mushroom isn't easy, you know...
There's a training area on the northwest side of $map:02000499$ where you can toss bombs around. Mushrooms can do it, and so can you.
You lost them? Well, that's all I had. So uhh, good luck.
Hehe! That looked fun. Wasn't that $npcName:29000403[gender:1]$ easy to defeat? If not, you're going to have a bad time in Mushtopia. Well, off you go then! Have fun!
Heheh! Welcome to $map:02000499$! There's a special gift for you in the chest behind me!
Hurry and open it!
Huh? The chest was empty? Try asking a nearby staff member!
My shift's almost over, so I'm thinking of heading over to the training area to toss some bombs around.
That sounds dangerous.

You mean it sounds like fun! Toss 'em up and watch them go boom. Give it a try. I think you get some kind of prize the first time you do it. Just uh, maybe aim away from the tourists. We don't want another incident.
Just three hours, twenty-nine minutes and thirty-seven seconds until my shift ends...
Huh? A mysterious force told you you'd get a gift if you talked to me? That's weird. Well, wouldn't want to disappoint the universe. Um, here, take these.
